data.title: Find out how to watch today's Olympics Opening Ceremony and save 17% on Peacock
data.meta_description: Sign up for Peacock to watch the Olympics Opening Ceremony. Opt for a Premium Annual plan to save 17% now.
data.text:
— Recommendations are independently chosen by Reviewed’s editors. Purchases you make through our links may earn us and our publishing partners a commission.

Athletes from around the world are going to Paris with one goal: taking home the gold. The 2024 Paris Olympics officially begin today, July 26, as the Olympic torch will be lit during the prestigious Opening Ceremony. To catch live coverage of the Summer Games and the entirety of the Olympics Opening Ceremony, sign up for Peacock and save 17% on a Premium Annual plan while you still can.

What time does the Paris Olympics Opening Ceremony start?

Opening Ceremonies officially start at 1:30 p.m. EST. From start to finish, the event should take around 4.5 hours.

How to watch the Olympics Opening Ceremony

Olympics on Peacock

Sign up for Peacock before the 2024 Summer Olympics kick off in Paris.

Sign up for Peacock

Streaming the Opening Ceremonies is simple. All you need to do is sign up for Peacock (or log in) to watch. A Peacock subscription will also get you live coverage of the Olympics to go along with full event replays, special documentaries and more.

Moreover, you can watch the procession with cable on NBC or use the NBC and NBC Olympic apps for easy viewing.

Is Peacock free?

No, but you can sign up and save if you act fast. The Premium Monthly plan costs $7.99 per month before tax ($95.88 over 12 months) while the Premium Annual plan sets you back $79.99 before tax. Choosing the Annual plan will let you save 17% and enjoy the Paris Olympics and plenty of other streaming content.

When are the Opening Ceremonies for the Olympics?

Opening Ceremonies for the 2024 Paris Olympics will begin today, July 26. The procession won't start in an Olympic Stadium, but rather the River Seine. Athletes from all over the world will ride on boats before finishing the introductory event at the Trocadéro.

Here's the deal: Subscribe to our Perks and Rec newsletter for daily savings on all the things you want and need.

How long are the summer Olympics in Paris?

The 2024 Paris Olympics will officially end on Sunday, August 11. That means the games will last a little under two weeks.

Olympics on Peacock

Sign up for Peacock before the 2024 Summer Olympics kick off in Paris.

Sign up for Peacock

Prices were accurate at the time this article was published but may change over time.
